message.content:
Step 1. Calculate the Free Cash Flow (FCF):
• From the cash flow statement, we have:
 – Net Cash Flow from Operating Activities = –4,504,752.68
 – Purchase of Fixed Assets (Capital Expenditure) = 2,496,137.92 (an outflow)
• FCF is computed as the sum of these two amounts:
  FCF = –4,504,752.68 + (–2,496,137.92) = –7,000,890.60

Step 2. Calculate the Current Assets Turnover Ratio:
• Use the income statement’s Total Revenue and the balance sheet’s Total Current Assets for the beginning and end of the period.
• Beginning Current Assets (2023-12-31): 8,000,000.00  
  Ending Current Assets (2024-02-03): 9,122,854.19  
• The Average Current Assets = (8,000,000.00 + 9,122,854.19) / 2 = 8,561,427.095  
• Total Revenue from the income statement = 791,992.51  
• Current Assets Turnover Ratio = Total Revenue / Average Current Assets  
  = 791,992.51 / 8,561,427.095 ≈ 0.0925, which we round to 0.09

Thus, the final solution is:

{"solution": {"Free Cash Flow (FCF)": "-7000890.60", "Current Assets Turnover Ratio": "0.09"}}
